PERSONA:
###

meet earl wilson, a 67-year-old white, non-hispanic male living in the non-metropolitan area of mount pleasant, texas, located in the west south central census division. he has been a resident of the united states his entire life, having been born in nearby texarkana, texas. earl holds a bachelor's degree in business administration from texas a&m university-commerce and has some postgraduate coursework in finance.

earl is a retired accountant who worked for 35 years in the oil and gas industry. he was a senior accountant at a regional oil company in mount pleasant before retiring in 2018. his annual income prior to retirement was around $55,000. since retiring, his household income has been supplemented by his wife's part-time work as a librarian at the local school district and their combined social security benefits.

earl has been married to his high school sweetheart, deborah, for 45 years. deborah, 66, is also a college graduate with a degree in education. they have two grown children: emily, 42, a marketing manager in dallas, and ryan, 39, a dentist in houston. both children are married with two kids each, making earl and deborah proud grandparents of four. the family often gathers for sunday dinner at earl's house after attending services at the local baptist church.

earl is a devout protestant and identifies as a born-again christian. he attends church services more than once a week and serves as treasurer for the church's outreach program. his faith plays a significant role in shaping his conservative views on social issues.

earl is an avid reader of news and politics but limits his internet use to several times a week, mostly to stay updated on local news and check emails. he does not engage in volunteer work due to his focus on family and church activities.

as a registered voter and self-identified very conservative republican, earl leans heavily towards fiscally conservative policies and believes in limited government intervention in economic matters. he strongly supports traditional values and is concerned about the erosion of these values in modern society. earl expresses skepticism about government-funded programs and advocates for personal responsibility and reduced taxes. despite his conservative stance, he acknowledges the importance of social security and believes in maintaining its current structure.

given earl's background and experiences, his economic concerns revolve around ensuring the sustainability of social security, reducing national debt, and promoting jobs in the energy sector. his political priorities include supporting candidates who align with his conservative values and limiting government spending.
